tag.description: NOTICE: You must also include the org.primefaces.extensions.resources-ckeditor:*.jar artifact. Client behavior events: save - fired when the save button will be pressed (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent), initialize - fired after the editor was successfully intialized (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent), focus - fired when the editor gets focus (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent), blur - fired when the editor loses focus (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent), wysiwygMode - fired after switching to the wysiwyg mode (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent), sourceMode - fired after switching to the source mode (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent), dirty - fired after the content has been changed wihout leaving the editor focus (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent), change - fired after blur and if the content has been changed (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent).

It may be a string, which either simply names the mode or is a MIME type associated with the mode. Alternatively, it may be an object containing configuration options for the mode, with a name property that names the mode (for example {name: "javascript", json: true}).

attribute.name: fitWidth

attribute.description: Controls the horizontal flow of the layout. By default, item elements start positioning at the left. Set to false for right-to-left layouts.
attribute.name: originLeft

attribute.description: Controls the vertical flow of the layout. By default, item elements start positioning at the top. Set to false for bottom-up layouts. It's like Tetris!

attribute.name: resizeBound

Rather, FluidGrid will layout item elements below stamped elements. You can use here every search expressions supported by PrimeFaces Search Expression Framework. Default is null.
attribute.name: stamp

attribute.description: Duration of the transition when items change position or appearance, set in a CSS time format. To disable all transitions, set this attribute to null. Default is 0.4s.
attribute.name: transitionDuration

attribute.description: Boolean flag if items contain any images. This can fix overlapping items which are caused by items that change size after a layout due to unloaded media like images. Setting this flag allows to layout all items after they have their proper sizes (images have been loaded). Default value is false.

attribute.description: Layout options as an instance of the class LayoutOptions or an JSON String representing serialized LayoutOptions. LayoutOptions created as Java model takes precedence over layout options as tag attributes. Serializing of layout options to an JSON string can increase the time of layout building when the layout is built during application startup in an application scoped bean (LayoutOptions gets always serialized to JSON to be able to be used in the underlying widget). Use the method toJson() in the LayoutOptions if you want to serialize all options to an JSON string.

attribute.description: Tip on toggler when pane is 'open'. Default is 'Close'.

attribute.description: Tip on toggler when pane is 'closed'. Default is 'Open'.
attribute.name: togglerTipClosed

attribute.description: Useful flag if you are dealing with iframes or objects like applets inside layout panes. This option triggers masking each time the mouse moves over a resizer - instead of waiting until your 'grab it' with your mouse. This is done just in case you are about to grab & drag the resizer. Enabling this avoids the slight delay that sometimes occurs when you quickly grab a resizer and try to drag over an iframe or object. Default is false.
attribute.name: maskPanesEarly

tag.description: Layout pane within Layout component. 5 regions are supported: 'north', 'south', 'center', 'west' und 'east'.

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Position of a pane. Possible values are 'north', 'south', 'west', 'east', 'center'. Default value is 'center'.
attribute.name: position

attribute.description: Style of the pane's header. Default value is null.
attribute.name: styleHeader

attribute.description: Style class of the pane's header. Default value is null.
attribute.name: styleClassHeader

attribute.description: Style of the pane's content. Default value is null.
attribute.name: styleContent

attribute.description: Style class of the pane's content. Default value is null.
attribute.name: styleClassContent

attribute.description: Makes a pane resizable. Default is true.
attribute.name: resizable

attribute.description: Makes a pane closable. Default is true.
attribute.name: closable

attribute.description: Specifies the initial size of a pane in px or %. Default value is null.
attribute.name: size

attribute.description: Specifies the minimum-size limit in px or % when resizing a pane. Default value is null.
attribute.name: minSize

attribute.description: Specifies the maximum-size limit in px or % when resizing a pane. Default value is null.
attribute.name: maxSize

attribute.description: Specifies the minimum-width limit in px or % when resizing a pane. Default value is null - as small as pane can go.
attribute.name: minWidth

attribute.description: Specifies the maximum-width limit in px or % when resizing a pane. Default value is null - as large as pane can go.
attribute.name: maxWidth

attribute.description: Specifies the minimum-height limit in px or % when resizing a pane. Default value is null - as small as pane can go.
attribute.name: minHeight

attribute.description: Specifies the maximum-height limit in px or % when resizing a pane. Default value is null - as large as pane can go.
attribute.name: maxHeight

attribute.description: Spacing in px between pane and adjacent pane - when pane is 'open'. Default value is 6.
attribute.name: spacingOpen

attribute.description: Spacing in px between pane and adjacent pane - when pane is 'closed'. Default value is 6.
attribute.name: spacingClosed

attribute.description: If true, then pane is 'closed' when layout is created. Default is false.
attribute.name: initClosed

attribute.description: If true, then pane is hidden when layout is created - no resizer or spacing is visible, as if the pane does not exist. Default is false.
attribute.name: initHidden

attribute.description: If true, then pane gets resized live while it is dragging. If false, only helper element shows resizing. Default is false.
attribute.name: resizeWhileDragging

attribute.description: Useful flag if you are dealing with iframes inside layout panes. If true, this option adds a DIV-mask over-or-inside this pane, so user can drag (resize) the pane over iframe. Default is false.
attribute.name: maskContents

attribute.description: Useful flag if you are dealing with objects like applets inside layout panes. If true, this option add IFRAME-mask over-or-inside this pane to cover objects / applets - content-mask will overlay this mask. Default is false.
attribute.name: maskObjects

tag.description: MasterDetail component allows to group contents into levels (sections) and saves page space. Smart and flexible navigation between levels via breadcrumbs or command components gives a neat and stylish interface for users.

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a naming container.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Current level in flow. It can be arbitrary initialized and gets updated with each navigation. It allows to show any initial level when a view with MasterDetail component(s) is displayed. Default is 1.
attribute.name: level

attribute.description: Context value for the current level. It can be arbitrary initialized at beginning and gets updated with each navigation. Default is null.
attribute.name: contextValue

attribute.description: Method with signature int methodName(SelectLevelEvent). Server-side listener invoking when a navigation attempt takes place (via pe:selectDetailLevel). Return value defines the level to go. Default is null.
attribute.name: selectLevelListener

attribute.description: Flag whether a breadcrumb navigation is shown or not. Default is true.
attribute.name: showBreadcrumb

attribute.description: Per default breadcrumb items right from the current level are not shown. This flag allows to show all breadcrumb items right from the current level as disabled. Default is false.
attribute.name: showAllBreadcrumbItems

attribute.description: Boolean flag to allow rendering of breadcrumb above or below header facet. Default is true.
attribute.name: breadcrumbAboveHeader

attribute.description: Style of the main MasterDetail container element. Default is null.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: Style class of the main MasterDetail container element. Default is null.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a naming container.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Level of this detail. Level is unique inside of masterDetail component. This is a required attribute. Default is none.
attribute.name: level

attribute.description: Variable to access the value set by pe:selectDetailLevel when the level is changed. If the value was not set by currently invoking pe:selectDetailLevel, the last set value is be used. Default is null.
attribute.name: contextVar

attribute.description: Label for the corresponding breadcrumb item shown on top. Default is none.
attribute.name: levelLabel

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether the breadcrumb item is disabled (not clickable). Default is dalse.
attribute.name: levelDisabled

attribute.description: Context value passing to the level to be navigated. Value defined here is accessible by contextVar in MasterDetailLevel. Default is none.
attribute.name: contextValue

attribute.description: Listener method which is fired before action / actionListener of component, pe:selectDetailLevel is attached to, gets called. Return value of this listener is used as a new / modified contextValue. The listener allows to pass a new / modified contextValue between levels. Default is none.
attribute.name: listener

attribute.description: Level to go to. Default is none.
attribute.name: level

attribute.description: Specifies how many steps to go. Can be negative. If level and step are not specified, then step = 1 is assumed. Default is none.
attribute.name: step

attribute.description: Specifies comma or blank separated list of clientIds of editable components whose inputs have to be preserved while levels get switched. @all is allowed and means all values within master detail have to be preserved. It makes sense e.g. if corresponding command component has "immediate"=true attribute. If nothing specified, input values gets cleared.
attribute.name: preserveInputs

attribute.description: Specifies comma or blank separated list of clientIds of editable components whose inputs have to be cleared while levels get switched. @all is allowed and means all values within master detail have to be cleared. It takes precedence over clientIds in preserveInputs.
attribute.name: resetInputs

attribute.description: Name(s) of one or several accepted events of f:ajax / p:ajax in case when SelectDetailLevel is attached to any component with ajax behavior. Several events should be defined as space or comma separated list. If no events are specified, all events will be accepted.
attribute.name: event

tag.description: blockUI blocks any piece of page during various Ajax calls.

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: Styles for the message when blocking. Styles should be defined as JSON object, e.g. {backgroundColor: 'fff', width: 30%}.
attribute.name: css

attribute.description: Styles for the overlay. Styles should be defined as JSON object, e.g. {opacity: 0.4, backgroundColor: 'red'}
attribute.name: cssOverlay

attribute.description: Specifies component(s) which send(s) an ajax request and triggers blocking. If nothing specified, the parent component is used.
attribute.name: source

attribute.description: Specifies component(s) or HTML element(s) to be blocked. If the target is null or not defined, the entire page is blocked.
attribute.name: target

attribute.description: Id of the component in terms of findComponent to be used as content shown during blocking. If nothing specified, the content of blockUI component is used.
attribute.name: content

attribute.description: Name(s) of one or several accepted events. Several events should be defined as space or comma separated list.
attribute.name: event

attribute.description: Flag whether the blocking is shown automatically without the need to use JavaScript widget. Default value is false.
attribute.name: autoShow

attribute.description: Time in millis to wait before auto-unblocking. Don't define it or set to 0 to disable auto-unblock. Default value is 0.
attribute.name: timeout

attribute.description: Set this attribute to true to have the message automatically centered along the X axis. Note: it only effects element blocking (page blocking controlled by CSS via the css attribute). Default value is true.
attribute.name: centerX

attribute.description: Set this attribute to true to have the message automatically centered along the Y axis. Default value is true.
attribute.name: centerY

tag.description: Time picker component for time (hours / minutes) inputs. Client behavior events: timeSelect - fires when an hour / minutes is selected (org.primefaces.extensions.event.TimeSelectEvent), close - fires when the time picker is closed (org.primefaces.extensions.event.CloseEvent), beforeShow - fires before the time picker is rendered and displayed (org.primefaces.extensions.event.BeforeShowEvent).

attribute.description: A method expression referring to a method validationg the input.

attribute.description: Style class of the time picker input element.

attribute.description: The character to use to separate hours and minutes. Default is :.
attribute.name: timeSeparator

attribute.description: Defines whether or not to show AM/PM with selected time. Default is false.

attribute.description: Corner of the dialog to position. Default is 'left top'.
attribute.name: dialogPosition

attribute.description: Corner of the input to position. Default is 'left bottom'.

attribute.description: Mode specifies appearance of time picker. Possible values are 'popup', 'spinner', 'inline'. Default is 'spinner'.
attribute.name: mode

attribute.description: Specifies first displayed hour. Possible range is 0-23. Default is 0.
attribute.name: startHours

attribute.description: Specifies last displayed hour. Possible range is 0-23. Default is 23.
attribute.name: endHours

attribute.description: Specifies first displayed minute. Possible range is 0-55. Default is 0.
attribute.name: startMinutes

attribute.description: Specifies last displayed minute. Possible range is 0-55. Default is 55.
attribute.name: endMinutes

attribute.description: Specifies interval of displayed minutes. Default is 5.
attribute.name: intervalMinutes

attribute.description: Specifies number of rows for the input tables, minimum 2, makes more sense if you use multiple of 2. Default is 4.
attribute.name: rows

attribute.description: Defines if the hours section is displayed or not. Set to false to get a minute only dialog. Default is true.
attribute.name: showHours

attribute.description: Defines if the minutes section is displayed or not. Set to false to get a hours only dialog. Default is true.
attribute.name: showMinutes

attribute.description: Shows an 'ok' button to confirm the edit. Default is false.
attribute.name: showCloseButton

attribute.description: Shows the 'deselect' time button. Default is false.
attribute.name: showDeselectButton

attribute.description: Shows the 'now' button. Default is false.
attribute.name: showNowButton

attribute.description: Defines a callback to enable / disable certain hours. Example: function onHourShow(hour). Default is null.
attribute.name: onHourShow

attribute.description: Defines a callback to enable / disable certain minutes. Example: function onMinuteShow(hour, minute). Default is null.

attribute.name: maxHour

attribute.description: Set the maximum minutes selectable by the user, disable minutes after max. minutes. Default is null (not set).
attribute.name: maxMinute

tag.description: Timeline is an interactive visualization chart to visualize events in time. Client behavior events: add - fired when event is about the be added (org.primefaces.extensions.event.timeline.TimelineAddEvent), change - fired after the user modified the start date or end date of an event by moving / dragging the event in the timeline (org.primefaces.extensions.event.timeline.TimelineModificationEvent), edit - fired when event is about to be edited. This event is fired when the user double clicks on an event (org.primefaces.extensions.event.timeline.TimelineModificationEvent), delete - fired when event is about to be deleted. That means the user clicked on the "delete event" button on the right of an event (org.primefaces.extensions.event.timeline.TimelineModificationEvent), select - fired when the user clicks on an event (org.primefaces.extensions.event.timeline.TimelineSelectEvent), rangechange - fired when the visible range is changing. Fired repeatedly while the user is modifying the visible time by moving / dragging the timeline or by zooming / scrolling (org.primefaces.extensions.event.timeline.TimelineRangeEvent), rangechanged - fired when the visible range has been changed. Fired once after the user has modified the visible time by moving / dragging the timeline or by zooming / scrolling (org.primefaces.extensions.event.timeline.TimelineRangeEvent), lazyload - fired when the events should be lazy loaded. Fired once after the user has modified the visible time by moving / dragging the timeline or by zooming / scrolling (org.primefaces.extensions.event.timeline.TimelineLazyLoadEvent), drop - fired when when an item is dragged and dropped onto the Timeline from outside (org.primefaces.extensions.event.timeline.TimelineDragDropEvent)

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: Inline style of the component
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: Container style class
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: An instance of TimelineModel representing the backing model.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: Name of the request-scoped variable for underlaying object in the TimelineEvent for each iteration.
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: Name of the request-scoped variable for underlaying object in the TimelineGroup for each iteration.
attribute.name: varGroup

attribute.description: User locale for i18n messages. The attribute can be either a String or Locale object.
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: Target time zone to convert start / end dates for displaying. This time zone is the time zone the user would like to see dates in UI. The attribute can be either a String or TimeZone object or null. If null, timeZone defaults to the server's time zone the application is running in.
attribute.name: timeZone

attribute.description: Time zone the user's browser / PC is running in. This time zone allows to correct the conversion of start / end dates to the target timeZone for displaying. The attribute can be either a String or TimeZone object or null. Note: browserTimeZone should be provided if the target timeZone is provided. If null, browserTimeZone defaults to the server's timeZone.
attribute.name: browserTimeZone

attribute.description: The height of the timeline in pixels, as a percentage, or "auto". When the height is set to "auto", the height of the timeline is automatically adjusted to fit the contents. If not, it is possible that events get stacked so high, that they are not visible in the timeline. When height is set to "auto", a minimum height can be specified with the option minHeight. Default is "auto".
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: Specifies a minimum height for the Timeline in pixels. Useful when height is set to "auto". Default is 0.
attribute.name: minHeight

attribute.description: The width of the timeline in pixels or as a percentage. Default is "100%".
attribute.name: width

attribute.description: Check if the timeline container is resized, and if so, resize the timeline. Useful when the webpage (browser window) or a layout pane / unit containing the timeline component is resized. Default is true.
attribute.name: responsive

attribute.description: If false, the horizontal axis is drawn at the bottom. If true, the axis is drawn on top. Default is false.
attribute.name: axisOnTop

attribute.description: The width of the drag areas in pixels. When an event with date range is selected, it has a drag area on the left and right side, with which the start or end dates of the event can be manipulated. Default is 10.
attribute.name: dragAreaWidth

attribute.description: If true, the events can be edited, changed, created and deleted. Events can only be editable when the option selectable is true (default). When editable is true, the timeline can fire AJAX events "change", "edit", "add", "delete", "drop". This global setting "editable" can be overwritten for individual events by setting a value in field "editable". Default is false.
attribute.name: editable

attribute.description: If true, events on the timeline are selectable. Selectable events can fire AJAX "select" events. Default is true.
attribute.name: selectable

attribute.description: If true, you can unselect an item by clicking in the empty space of the timeline. If false, you cannot unselect an item, there will be always one item selected. Default is true.
attribute.name: unselectable

attribute.description: If true, the timeline is zoomable. When the timeline is zoomed, AJAX "rangechange" events are fired. Default is true.
attribute.name: zoomable

attribute.description: If true, the timeline is movable. When the timeline is moved, AJAX "rangechange" events are fired. Default is true.
attribute.name: moveable

attribute.description: The initial start date for the axis of the timeline. If not provided, the earliest date present in the events is taken as start date. Default is null.
attribute.name: start

attribute.description: The initial end date for the axis of the timeline. If not provided, the latest date present in the events is taken as end date. Default is null.
attribute.name: end

attribute.description: Set a minimum Date for the visible range. It will not be possible to move beyond this minimum. Default is null.
attribute.name: min

attribute.description: Set a maximum Date for the visible range. It will not be possible to move beyond this maximum. Default is null.
attribute.name: max

attribute.description: Set a minimum zoom interval for the visible range in milliseconds. It will not be possible to zoom in further than this minimum. Default is 10.
attribute.name: zoomMin

attribute.description: Set a maximum zoom interval for the visible range in milliseconds. It will not be possible to zoom out further than this maximum. Default value equals 315360000000000 ms (about 10000 years).
attribute.name: zoomMax

attribute.description: Preload factor is a positive float value or 0 which can be used for lazy loading of events. When the lazy loading feature is active, the calculated time range for preloading will be multiplicated by the preload factor. The result of this multiplication specifies the additional time range which will be considered for the preloading during moving / zooming too. For example, if the calculated time range for preloading is 5 days and the preload factor is 0.2, the result is 5 * 0.2 = 1 day. That means, 1 day backwards and / or 1 day onwards will be added to the original calculated time range. The event's area to be preloaded is wider then. This helps to avoid frequently, time-consuming fetching of events. Default value is 0.
attribute.name: preloadFactor

attribute.description: The minimal margin in pixels between events. Default is 10.
attribute.name: eventMargin

attribute.description: The minimal margin in pixels between events and the horizontal axis. Default is 10.
attribute.name: eventMarginAxis

attribute.description: Specifies the style for the timeline events. Choose from "dot" or "box". Default is "box".
attribute.name: eventStyle

attribute.description: If true, items can be moved from one group to another. Only applicable when groups are used. Default is true.
attribute.name: groupsChangeable

attribute.description: If false, the groups legend is drawn at the left side of the timeline. If true, the groups legend is drawn on the right side. Default is false.
attribute.name: groupsOnRight

attribute.description: Allows to customize the way groups are ordered. When true (default), groups will be ordered by content alphabetically (when the list of groups is missing) or by native ordering of TimelineGroup object in the list of groups (when the list of groups is available). When false, groups will not be ordered at all.
attribute.name: groupsOrder

attribute.description: By default, the width of the groups legend is adjusted to the group names. A fixed width can be set for the groups legend by specifying the "groupsWidth" as a string, for example "200px". Default is null.
attribute.name: groupsWidth

attribute.description: If true, the start and end of an event will be snapped nice integer values when moving or resizing the event. Default is true.
attribute.name: snapEvents

attribute.description: If true, the events are stacked above each other to prevent overlapping events. Default is true.
attribute.name: stackEvents

attribute.description: If true, the timeline shows a red, vertical line displaying the current time. Default is true.
attribute.name: showCurrentTime

attribute.description: By default, the timeline shows both minor and major date labels on the horizontal axis. For example the minor labels show minutes and the major labels show hours. When "showMajorLabels" is false, no major labels are shown. Default is true.
attribute.name: showMajorLabels

attribute.description: By default, the timeline shows both minor and major date labels on the horizontal axis. For example the minor labels show minutes and the major labels show hours. When "showMinorLabels" is false, no minor labels are shown. When both "showMajorLabels" and "showMinorLabels" are false, no horizontal axis will be visible. Default is true.
attribute.name: showMinorLabels

attribute.description: Show the button "Create new event" in the a navigation menu. Default is false.
attribute.name: showButtonNew

attribute.description: Show a navigation menu with buttons to move and zoom the timeline. Default is false.
attribute.name: showNavigation

attribute.description: If false, items can not be moved or dragged horizontally (neither start time nor end time is changable). This is useful when items should be editable but can only be changed regarding group or content (typical use case: scheduling events). Default is true.
attribute.name: timeChangeable

attribute.description: Style class to apply when an acceptable draggable is dragged over. Default is null.
attribute.name: dropHoverStyleClass

attribute.description: Style class to apply when an acceptable draggable is being dragged over. Default is null.
attribute.name: dropActiveStyleClass

attribute.description: Selector to define the accepted draggables. Default is null.
attribute.name: dropAccept

attribute.description: Scope key to match draggables and droppables. Default is null.
attribute.name: dropScope

attribute.description: When true, events are moved animated when resizing or moving them. This is very pleasing for the eye, but does require more computational power. Default is true.
attribute.name: animate

attribute.description: When true, events are moved animated when zooming the Timeline. This looks cool, but does require more computational power. Default is true.
attribute.name: animateZoom

tag.description: AjaxErrorHandler catchs AJAX ERRORS and show it in modal window or change.

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a naming container.

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget. Allows to define widget name on frontend with methods hide() and isVisible(). If XHTML contain more ajaxErrorHandler with widgetWar, every widgetWar is the same JavaScript object
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: Exception class name. If type is not defined, ajaxErrorHandler is defined for all exceptions. If type is defined, ajaxErrorHandler is defined for this type exception.
attribute.name: type

attribute.description: Title text in popup ERROR BOX. Default is: {error-name}.
attribute.name: title

attribute.description: Body text/html in popup ERROR BOX. Default is: {error-message}.
attribute.name: body

attribute.description: Button text in popup ERROR BOX. Default is: Reload.
attribute.name: button

attribute.description: Javascript function for Button in popup ERROR BOX. Default is JavaScript function for RELOAD content.
attribute.name: buttonOnclick

attribute.description: Javascript function(error, response). This function is called before construct ERROR BOX on client side. If this function returns FALSE, follows steps are breaked and construct information with description.
attribute.name: onerror

tag.description: Waypoint makes it easy to execute a custom logic whenever you scroll to an element. Client behavior events: reached - fired when the user scrolls past the element. (org.primefaces.extensions.event.WaypointEvent)

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: The target component registered as waypoint. If null, the parent component will be taken as target. Default is null.
attribute.name: for

attribute.description: The context defines which scrollable element the waypoint belongs to and acts within. It can be a component or plain HTML element like a div. Default is window if nothing specified.
attribute.name: forContext

attribute.description: If false, this waypoint will be created but will be disabled from triggering. You can call widget's method "enable" to turn it back on. Default is true.
attribute.name: enabled

attribute.description: Default waypoints live on the vertical axis. Their offset is calculated in relation to the top of the viewport and they listen for vertical scroll changes. If horizontal is set to true, offset is calculated in relation to the left of the viewport and listens for horizontal scroll changes. For instance, the value 50 means "when the left side of this element reaches 50px from the left side of the viewport". Default is false.
attribute.name: horizontal

attribute.description: This option determines how far the top of the element must be from the top of the viewport to trigger a waypoint (callback function). It can be a number, which is taken as a number of pixels (can be also negativ, e.g. -10), a string representing a percentage of the viewport height (e.g. '50%') or a function that will return a number of pixels. Default is 0.
attribute.name: offset

attribute.description: If true, and multiple waypoints are triggered in one scroll, this waypoint will trigger even if it is not the last waypoint reached. If false, it will only trigger if it is the last waypoint. Default is true.
attribute.name: continuous

attribute.description: If true, the waypoint will be destroyed when triggered. Default is false.
attribute.name: triggerOnce

Generate QR codes dynamically qrCode
org.primefaces.extensions.component.QRCode org.primefaces.extensions.component.QRCodeRenderer
Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
id false java.lang.String
An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
binding false javax.faces.component.UIComponent
Render method: canvas, img or div. Default value is canvas
renderMethod false java.lang.String
Render method: 0: normal 1: label strip 2: label box 3: image strip 4: image box Default value is 0
renderMode false java.lang.Integer
Version min range. Default value is 1
minVersion false java.lang.Integer
Version max range. Default value is 40
maxVersion false java.lang.Integer
error correction level: `'L'`, `'M'`, `'Q'` or `'H'. Default value `'L'`
ecLevel false java.lang.String
offset in pixel if drawn onto existing canvas. Default is 0
leftOffset false java.lang.Long
offset in pixel if drawn onto existing canvas. Default is 0
topOffset false java.lang.Long
Size in pixel. Default is 200px
size false java.lang.Long
QRCode content text. Default is empty
text false java.lang.String
QRCode content label font. Default is sans
fontName false java.lang.String
QRCode content label color. Default is #000
fontColor false java.lang.String
QRCode content label. Default is empty
label false java.lang.String
Code color or image element. Default is #000
fillColor false java.lang.String
Background color or image element, empty for transparent background. Default is transparent
background false java.lang.String
Corner radius relative to module width: 0.0 .. 0.5. Default value is 0.0
radius false java.lang.Double
Quiet zone in modules. Default value is 0.0
quiet false java.lang.Double
V
Label size percentage. Default value is 0.1
mSize false java.lang.Double
Label relative Y position. Default value is 0.5
mPosX false java.lang.Double

tag.description: Timer Component

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: set to true to hide the timer. The listener will be fired anyway
attribute.name: visible

attribute.description: An el expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: Timeut in seconds to do the ajax ajax requests. Default is 10.
attribute.name: timeout

attribute.description: Component(s) to be updated with ajax.
attribute.name: update

attribute.description: A method expression to invoke by polling.
attribute.name: listener

attribute.description: Boolean value that determines the phaseId, when true actions are processed at apply_request_values, when false at invoke_application phase.
attribute.name: immediate

attribute.description: Javascript handler to execute before ajax request is begins.
attribute.name: onstart

attribute.description: Javascript handler to execute when ajax request is completed.
attribute.name: oncomplete

attribute.description: Component id(s) to process partially instead of whole view.
attribute.name: process

attribute.description: Javascript handler to execute when ajax request fails.
attribute.name: onerror

attribute.description: Javascript handler to execute when ajax request succeeds.
attribute.name: onsuccess

attribute.description: Global ajax requests are listened by ajaxStatus component, setting global to false will not trigger ajaxStatus. Default is true.
attribute.name: global

attribute.description: If less than delay milliseconds elapses between calls to request() only the most recent one is sent and all other requests are discarded. The default value of this option is 300. If the value of delay is the literal string 'none' without the quotes, no delay is used.
attribute.name: delay

attribute.description: The format to use when diplaying the value. Accepted values are: 'percentage' to diplay the remaining time as percentage. 'Human' to print a human readable interval. Any other value will be evaluated as a moment.js format
attribute.name: format

attribute.description: client-side function used to format the remaining duration
attribute.name: formatFunction

attribute.description: When set to true, ajax requests are not queued. Default is false.
attribute.name: async

attribute.description: In autoStart mode, the timer will start immediatly. Default is true.
attribute.name: autoStart

attribute.description: Use this attribute to set the timer direction. Default value is false (backward)
attribute.name: forward

attribute.description: set to true to false the timer periodic. Default is true
attribute.name: singleRun

attribute.description: When enabled, only values related to partially processed components would be serialized for ajax instead of whole form.
attribute.name: partialSubmit

attribute.description: If true, indicate that this particular Ajax transaction is a value reset transaction. This will cause resetValue() to be called on any EditableValueHolder instances encountered as a result of this ajax transaction. If not specified, or the value is false, no such indication is made.
attribute.name: resetValues

attribute.description: If true, components which autoUpdate="true" will not be updated for this request. If not specified, or the value is false, no such indication is made.
attribute.name: ignoreAutoUpdate

attribute.description: Javascript handler executed every second
attribute.name: ontimerstep

attribute.description: Javascript handler executed the timeout stops
attribute.name: ontimercomplete
